definition: to raise one's foot/to stand on tiptoe/stilts

sentences.english: The whole shebang smells sort of fishy to me.
sentences.chinese: 整個事情使我覺得有點蹊蹺。

sentences.english: An innocent child died oddly in an inn.
sentences.chinese: 一名天真的孩子在一個客棧蹊蹺地死了。

sentences.english: This sounds a bit odd for several reasons.
sentences.chinese: 由於幾個原因，這聽起來有些蹊蹺。

sentences.english: With such extraordinary coincidence, the origin of Snail Pit Village was rather freaky.
sentences.chinese: 建築巧合造就神奇，田螺坑地名的來歷頗爲蹊蹺。

sentences.english: Thinking that was a bit odd, I went in.
sentences.chinese: 覺得有點蹊蹺，我走了進去。

sentences.english: Chang Lan sense something fishy about his feeling and immediately guess is beam whilst make of ghost.
sentences.chinese: 常蘭感覺事有蹊蹺並立刻猜到是梁守業搞的鬼。

sentences.english: Some non-plot seems to be a mystery to tamper with the real world.
sentences.chinese: 有些情節似乎帶有非現實世界的蹊蹺神祕。

sentences.english: Lisa asked Julia, who was watching everything.
sentences.chinese: 莉莎看着一切甚是蹊蹺，邊起了問茱莉亞。

sentences.english: However plant loose feel that this matter has a hitch.
sentences.chinese: 不過植松覺得這件事有點蹊蹺。

sentences.english: Reflected chardonnay with autumn see crescent to commend pavilion please maid, think things have a catch in it somewhere.
sentences.chinese: 映霞與知秋見新月到薦人館請丫環，覺得事有蹊蹺。

sentences.english: It's not only strange, it's unbelievable.
sentences.chinese: 它不僅蹊蹺，而且令人難以置信。

sentences.english: ChangLan feeling can smell a rat and immediately guess is the sovereignty of the beam have demons.
sentences.chinese: 常蘭感覺事有蹊蹺並立刻猜到是梁守業搞的鬼。

sentences.english: Even more odd, the street was filled by an unbroken silence.
sentences.chinese: 甚至更爲蹊蹺的是，這條街道鴉雀無聲，寂靜異常。

definition: inside information/the ins and outs of the matter/how things stand/what's up
(of a plot etc) to fall through and stand exposed
sth one wishes to keep secret/ulterior motive/a subject best avoided
to have second thoughts about sth/to think better of
to lose one's head out of fear (idiom)
lit. heart alarmed, body leaping (idiom); fear and trepidation in the face of disaster
